data.title: The Town of West New York
data.text:
Notice of Board of Commissioners Meeting

The Mayor and Board of Commissioners of the Town of West New York have a regularly scheduled meeting on Wednesday, August 21, 2024 beginning at 12:00 PM. (No Work Session) via video conference.

In accordance with N.J.S.A. 10:4-8(b), and guidance from the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs, Division of Local Government Services, this public meeting will be held using remote technology. Be advised that the Board may enter Executive Session to discuss items which fall within an exception of the open public meetings act and permits the Board of Commissioners to have private discussion since it deals with specific exceptions contained in N.J.S.A. 10:4-12(b) including: matters of personnel, matters of litigation, and other matters as rendered confidential by law.

Details on how to access and participate in the public hearing through remote technology are listed herein and will be posted on the Towns’ website at http://www.www.westnewyorknj.org/. Please note, members of the public are strongly advised to submit questions prior to the meeting via email to townclerk@westnewyorknj.org on any matter before the board to allow for any member of the public who may want to participate to do so prior and during the course of the meeting. Participants opting to call in may participate and must raise their hand during the public session portion by pressing star nine (*9). Once recognized by the host, the participant will be allowed to speak for three minutes. Participants will be asked to provide their name and address for the record.

Instructions for participating in the public hearing are as follows: Town of West New York Board of Commissioners Meeting – August 21, 2024 at 12:00 PM (No Work Session) Eastern Standard Time

Call-In Number: (929) 205- 6099

Meeting ID: 853 2918 2318

Passcode: 42860

Website: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85329182318?pwd=YjB3YjlXOFg5Tm9yWUdnNXJYcFJ0UT09

As ordered by the Mayor and Board of Commissioners of the Town of West New York, N.J.

Dated: 8/14/2024

Adelinny Plaza, RMC

Town Clerk

Drunk Driving Enforcement starting August 17, 2024

“Every day, about 37 people in the United States die in drunk-driving crashes; that’s one person every 39 minutes. About 31% of all traffic crash fatalities in the United States involve drunk drivers. In 2021, 13,384 people died in alcohol-impaired driving traffic deaths, a 14% increase from 2020. These deaths were all preventable.

In order to try to prevent these deaths and other risky behaviors on our roads, our Department will be conducting a Drunk Driving Enforcement detail starting this weekend, August 17, 2024, from 0000-0400hrs. The detail will run on weekends through labor day. The enforcement activities are aimed at preventing drunk driving and raising awareness about the dangers of impaired driving.”

West New York Police Department and the use of Body-Worn Video Cameras

The West New York Police Department is committed to transparency and accountability through the use of body-worn video cameras by our officers. As part of our dedication to effective policing and in alignment with guidelines set forth by the New Jersey Attorney General, these cameras are being deployed to enhance public trust and ensure the safety of both our officers and citizens.

Body Worn Camera (BWC) footage functions similar to recordings from cell phone cameras, where the cameras, affixed to an officer’s uniform, will capture interactions within their field of vision. This proactive measure aims to strengthen community partnerships and uphold the highest standards of law enforcement practices.

By interacting with our officers, individuals acknowledge the potential recording of such interactions for transparency and public safety purposes.

West New York Community Calendar – July, 2024

No Parking on Boulevard East (both sides of the street) from 6AM-11PM on Thursday, July 4th, 2024.

Mayor Albio Sires and the Board of Commissioners want to make you aware that there will be no parking on Boulevard East (both side of the street) from 6AM-11PM on Thursday, July 4th, 2024.

In addition, we will close both Boulevard East and River Road to traffic starting at 4PM on July 4th.

After 11 years, the Macy’s Fireworks display is coming back to the Hudson River.

Our main goal is to ensure that emergency vehicles (Police, Fire, and Ambulance) can move easily through the town. We want to ensure everyone has a safe day.

While road closures might be inconvenient, they are necessary because of the number of people coming to WNY and the surrounding area to view the fireworks. We are doing everything we can to avoid traffic jams and gridlock. We strongly suggest that residents stay in town and enjoy the fireworks.

WNY Pool hours for Thursday, July 4th

Mayor Albio Sires and the Board of Commissioners want to make you aware of the WNY Pool hours for Thursday, July 4th.

The pool Will be open from 10AM-4PM.

Have a happy and safe 4th of July!

Miller Park Community Garden

Mayor Albio Sires and the Board of Commissioners invite you to join the Miller Park Community Garden.

The community garden will serve as a space for individuals of all ages and backgrounds. We aim to foster a sense of connection, environmental stewardship, and food security within our town. The community garden is dedicated to providing opportunities for education, art expression, and therapeutic benefits.

The garden is Free for West New York Residents and features:

40 Plots

4 Wheelchair Accessible Raised Beds

Join today at https://bit.ly/millerparkgarden

We will also accept applications from volunteers who wish to assist but do not want to garden.

An application can be filled out by clicking on the link provided or you can obtain one at the Mayor’s Office, we have applications in both English and Spanish. For any inquiries or assistance , please feel free to reach out to the Sustainability Coordinator, Rosemarie Suarez, at rosezuares@westnewyorknj.org at 201-295-5119.

Notice of Board of Commissioners Meeting

The Mayor and Board of Commissioners of the Town of West New York have a regularly scheduled meeting on Wednesday, August 7, 2024 beginning at 12:00 PM. (No Work Session) via video conference.

In accordance with N.J.S.A. 10:4-8(b), and guidance from the New Jersey Department of Community Affairs, Division of Local Government Services, this public meeting will be held using remote technology. Be advised that the Board may enter Executive Session to discuss items which fall within an exception of the open public meetings act and permits the Board of Commissioners to have private discussion since it deals with specific exceptions contained in N.J.S.A. 10:4-12(b) including: matters of personnel, matters of litigation, and other matters as rendered confidential by law.

Details on how to access and participate in the public hearing through remote technology are listed herein and will be posted on the Towns’ website at http://www.www.westnewyorknj.org/. Please note, members of the public are strongly advised to submit questions prior to the meeting via email to townclerk@westnewyorknj.org on any matter before the board to allow for any member of the public who may want to participate to do so prior and during the course of the meeting. Participants opting to call in may participate and must raise their hand during the public session portion by pressing star nine (*9). Once recognized by the host, the participant will be allowed to speak for three minutes. Participants will be asked to provide their name and address for the record.

West New York Police Department and the use of Body-Worn Video Cameras

The West New York Police Department is committed to transparency and accountability through the use of body-worn video cameras by our officers. As part of our dedication to effective policing and in alignment with guidelines set forth by the New Jersey Attorney General, these cameras are being deployed to enhance public trust and ensure the safety of both our officers and citizens.

Body Worn Camera (BWC) footage functions similar to recordings from cell phone cameras, where the cameras, affixed to an officer’s uniform, will capture interactions within their field of vision. This proactive measure aims to strengthen community partnerships and uphold the highest standards of law enforcement practices.

By interacting with our officers, individuals acknowledge the potential recording of such interactions for transparency and public safety purposes.

FOR THE TOWN OF WEST NEW YORK FOR THE 2024 CALENDAR YEAR

The Mayor and the Board of Commissioners Public Meeting scheduled on July 17, 2024 for the Town of West New York shall is hereby cancelled.

No Parking on Boulevard East (both sides of the street) from 6AM-11PM on Thursday, July 4th, 2024.

Mayor Albio Sires and the Board of Commissioners want to make you aware that there will be no parking on Boulevard East (both side of the street) from 6AM-11PM on Thursday, July 4th, 2024.

In addition, we will close both Boulevard East and River Road to traffic starting at 4PM on July 4th.

After 11 years, the Macy’s Fireworks display is coming back to the Hudson River.

Our main goal is to ensure that emergency vehicles (Police, Fire, and Ambulance) can move easily through the town. We want to ensure everyone has a safe day.

While road closures might be inconvenient, they are necessary because of the number of people coming to WNY and the surrounding area to view the fireworks. We are doing everything we can to avoid traffic jams and gridlock. We strongly suggest that residents stay in town and enjoy the fireworks.
